info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 31 at 7:40AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Stephens, northwestern Anderson, southwestern Pickens and Oconee Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 740 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Walhalla, or near Westminster, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clemson, Seneca, Walhalla, Pickens, Easley, Central, Pendleton, Liberty, Westminster and Norris. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
